project.title: Bridge Mtce Unvoted
project.description: It is proposed to carryout maintenance works of the six bridges in Sylvania Waters. The bridges exhibited cracking, rust staining, delaminated concrete and concrete spalls due to reinforcement corrosion and in need of repairs. Bridge maintenance works involve concrete patch repairs in conjunction with Hybrid Cathodic Protection to prevent further corrosion and prolong the life of the bridges.
project.status: Engaged consultant to design bridge maintenance works of six bridges in Sylvania Waters. Tenders will be invited for construction of bridge repair works, following completion of detail design work.

project.title: Prince Edward Park Pedestrian Bridge
project.description: Bridge repair works and corrosion protective treatment of the Prince Edward Park, Footbridge Woronora. project.location: Prince Edward Park, Footbridge Woronora NSW

project.title: Greenhills Stage 1A Amenities Building
project.description: Design and Construction of a new Amenities Building to service the new Sporting fields at Stage 1A
project.status:
Stage 1A amenities will commence on the 25/11/13 as per Australand program issued at PCG for August 13 and complete on the 28/3/14. Part of the works required to be assessed is the sewer infrastructure which directly affects the amenities building given its proximity to the lines. Australand need to structurally deal with the pipework prior to the amenities being constructed given the works are within the zone of influence
The Amenities building is to be constructed by Australand (developer) as part of the VPA works. Council will have an over-sight into the project only to ensure it is delivered in accordance with our brief. The civil contractor engaged by Australand is Burtons.

project.title: Greenhills Hockey Field Construction Stage 1B
project.description: Design and Construction of two Hockey Field facilities with ancillary services.
project.status:
The following scope was agreed at a meeting held on the 29/8/13 where multiple parties were involved to agree the required methodology for the civil works associated with stage 1B hockey field. Move the existing sand layer form Australands site across to Breens site to create a level platform at about 1 m above the groundwater surface but not more than 1.5 m which will then receive the required sandstone capping layer included in the 1 m to 1.5 m thickness which will allow impact rolling to be undertaken. The contractors should undertake testing at an appropriate spacing and to a depth of at least 2 m deeper than the inferred base of loose sand to ensure compaction is being adequately undertaken across the site. This would probably require some additional initial CPTs to ensure that the whole of the impact rolling area is appropriately covered. Import/ or use existing agreed sand material to allow uniform layering across the whole site, ( ignoring the boundary between sites) and provide 98% standard compaction of the material up to the required level (or 80% density index, as relevant for the soil type). Ensure all compaction is undertaken within 2% of standard optimum moisture content, or equivalent. Provide a crushed sandstone layer on top of the above work to ensure that the subgrade work that is required for the hockey field will be completed as close as possible to the design grades required that have been produced by the hockey field designer( Sports Surface Consultants). Capping should be at least 0.5 m thick. Geotech to satisfy itself that the proposed material that Breens and Australand have stockpiled meets the criteria that was agreed in the meeting. If not advise in the report whether the material fails to achieve the desired outcome and establish an appropriate material specification with material zones, as relevant for the filling embankment. Advise what material is proposed for each of the above stages and what criteria must be met performance wise. and outline minimum testing requirements and frequencies. Layer depths and all earthworks specifications and methodologies are to be specified by Geotech and peer reviewed by Douglas Partners to ensure concurrence of the proposed methodology is achieved. Provide a methodology to test the effects that the impact rolling will have on the sewer infrastructure within the confines of the hockey boundaries and also include a methodology to test the effects the impact rolling will have on the sewer where the batters on the outer most extremities of the field are to be constructed. Douglass Partners to provide peer review of the methodology once Geoenviro have provided the scope for above. Include provision in the methodology for compaction and vibration monitoring trials
This methodology once received will be priced by both Australand and Breen's and the costs associated with this issued to Council for review/approval. If the scope is agreed then the hockey field civil works can be promptly completed and the hockey field contractor can be engaged to commence works

project.title: Greenhills Hockey Clubhouse Stage 1B
project.description: Design and Construction of the Clubhouse to service the new Hockey Fields 2 and 3 @ Stage 1B
project.status:
Bulk Earthworks for Stage 1B have yet to commence to allow the Amenities building to be constructed on.
This Amenities building is to be constructed by Acubuild once a firm commencement date can be provided by Australand based upon the bulk earthworks completing. Council will contractually engage Acubuild and oversee the works to completion. The contractor engaged by Australand to undertake the bulk earthworks will probably be Burtons who will undertake the bulk earth works.

project.title: Associated works for boat ramp at Scylla Bay oval/carpark
project.description: Implementation of Scylla Bay Masterplan Stage 1: Upgrade car park and replace jetty
project.status: Following consideration of SAF036-14 at its meeting on 16 September 2013, Council resolved: 1. That the report on the condition of the Gunnamatta Road (Hospital Bay), Burraneer (Lugano Avenue), Scylla Bay jetties be received and noted. 2. That the results of community consultation be received and noted. 3. That the heritage assessment of the jetties be received and noted. 4. That the course of action detailed in the body of the report for each jetty be adopted: * Undertake structural repairs to the Scylla Bay jetty to allow it to be reopened for public use over the 2013/14 boating season. * Replace the Scylla Bay jetty with a modern timber jetty in the same location and in accordance with the Scylla Bay masterplan to retain continuity of use at the site. * Use a similar form, materials, alignment and finish to the existing structure with the inclusion of a floating pontoon. * Conserve the original stone fabric of the abutment in the new design. * Include the Scylla Bay jetty on the SSC LEP Schedule of Heritage Items. * Consider installation of interpretive signage or pavement plaques which explains the history and significance of the jetty to the community.

project.title: Captain Cook Drive, Woolooware to Eloura Road - Stage 1
project.description: Proposed to replace the existing two lane carriageway with a four lane divided carriageway with bicycle, breakdown lanes on both sides. Stage 1 works include construction of new retaining wall and east bound carriageway to the north of the existing travelling lanes
project.location: Captain Cook Drive Woolooware road to Elouera Rd

project.title: Captain Cook Drive 2012/13
project.status: RMS Grant Funding for Captain Cook Drive Construction.

project.title: Captain Cook Drive, Widening STAGE 2 extending From Elouera Rd to 200m frm Woolooware Rd
project.description:
Stage 2 work involves reconstruction of the two existing travelling lanes, (adjacent to the golf course), to new levels which will match the (elevated) roadway levels already constructed in Stage 1.
Stage 2 work will start with the diversion of the two-way traffic flow onto the new Stage 1 elevated roadway, adjacent to the mangroves.
Once this diversion of raffic flow occurs, Stage 2 construction can happen along the southern side of the road reservation, adjacent to the golf course.
Once the four travelling lanes are completed, traffic flow will be changed so that there are two travelling lanes in each direction.
Stage 2 works will also include a 2.5m sealed shoulder on both sides which will improve the amenity for pedal cyclists.
project.location: Captain Cook Drive, between Eloura Road and 200m from Woolooware Rd, Woolooware 2230
project.status: In order to achieve better value for money the following actions have been undertaken (a) Sandstone reinforcement of stormwater outlets has been replaced with a lower cost option; and (b) Testing of the existing pavement has been undertaken to provide more certainty for pavement options.

project.title: Sylvania Waters - Maintenance Dredging
project.description: Maintenance dredging of Sylvania Waters canals
project.status:
Materials Testing had done the soil sampling & analysis for the project, Survey Services had done the hydrographic survey, and I had invited selected environmental consultants to quote for the aquatic ecology survey. These quotes close this Friday 30/08/2013.
Just last Friday I learnt there is a requirement for maintenance dredging at another site in Sylvania Waters. New Site 7A is in a Sylvania Waters canal between Bellinger Place and Wollondilly Place, and is upstream of Site 7. I've attached a revised Key diagram for Sylvania Waters hydrographic survey sites and aerial photograph of new Site 7A I have already requested soil sampling & analysis, an hydrographic survey and quotes for an aquatic ecology survey of new Site 7A.

project.title: Burraneer Jetty (aka Lugano Avenue wharf)
project.status: Following consideration of SAF036-14 at its meeting on 16 September 2013, Council resolved: 1. That the report on the condition of the Gunnamatta Road (Hospital Bay), Burraneer (Lugano Avenue), Scylla Bay jetties be received and noted. 2. That the results of community consultation be received and noted. 3. That the heritage assessment of the jetties be received and noted. 4. That the course of action detailed in the body of the report for each jetty be adopted: * Replace the Burraneer Jetty with a modern timber jetty in a similar location, to retain the continuity of use at the site; * Retain and conserve physical evidence of the original built sandstone abutment at the Burraneer Jetty during future redevelopment of the site.

project.title: Gunnamatta Road Jetty (aka Hospital Bay jetty)
project.status: Following consideration of SAF036-14 at its meeting on 16 September 2013, Council resolved: 1. That the report on the condition of the Gunnamatta Road (Hospital Bay), Burraneer (Lugano Avenue), Scylla Bay jetties be received and noted. 2. That the results of community consultation be received and noted. 3. That the heritage assessment of the jetties be received and noted. 4. That the course of action detailed in the body of the report for each jetty be adopted: * Replace the Hospital Bay jetty with a modern timber jetty in the same location to retain continuity of use at the site. * Use the form, materials, alignment and finish of the existing structure with the inclusion of a floating pontoon. * Conserve the original stone fabric of the abutment in the new design. * Conserve the original rock cut steps above the jetty. * Consider installation of interpretive signage or pavement plaques which outline the history and significance of the jetty to the community. 5. That provision be made in the forthcoming 2014/15 draft Budget for the replacement of the Hospital Bay Jetty.

project.title: Lilli Pilli Tidal Baths & Jetty upgrade
project.description: Upgrade baths area including jetty, wharf and nets and upfrade associated facilities as required (handrails, footpaths, etc)
project.status: Parks & Waterways issue Brief to Project Services to upgrade the baths including the jetty, wharf and nets and upgrade associated facilities as required (ie. seats, handrails, footpaths etc).
